definition: to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
to be severe with oneself and lenient with others (idiom)
pinyin: yan2 yi3 ze2 ji3 kuan1 yi3 dai4 ren2

sentences.english: Be strict to oneself , be more tolerant to others .
sentences.chinese: 严于律己，更要宽以待人。

sentences.english: To err is human:to forgive, divine.
I can teach you about kindness, but I cannot force you to be gracious.
sentences.chinese: 我能教你与人为善，但不能强迫你宽以待人。

sentences.english: Whoever wants to get help when in trouble must be lenient with others everyday life.
sentences.chinese: 谁若想在困厄时得到援助，平时就应宽以待人。

sentences.english: Be strict with yourself and lenient toward others.

definition: to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
What you don't want done to you, don't do to others. (idiom, from the Confucian analects)/Do as you would be done by./Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.
pinyin: ji3 suo3 bu4 yu4 , wu4 shi1 yu2 ren2

definition: self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
